Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at events 1-3: Temperature is around 20-21°C, pressure is 1 bar, vibration is 0, material flow is 0, tool position is 0, and energy is 0.4-0.5 kWh. These seem like a baseline or idle state.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Event 4: Temperature jumps to 50°C, pressure still 1, vibration 30 Hz, material flow 5 units/s, tool position 5 mm, energy 2.00 kWh. Thats a significant increase in temperature and vibration.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Events 4-6: High temp, vibration, tool movement. This could be Cutting Metal. The tool is moving (position increasing), high vibration and temp. Cutting often involves high heat and vibration.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Event 7: Temp drops to 40, pressure 2, vibration 10, flow 2, tool position 15. Energy back to 2.0. The vibration and temp have decreased.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Events 7-8: Lower vibration, temp, but tool position is 15. Maybe a transition phase. Could this be a pause between cutting and another step.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Event 9: Temp jumps to 80, pressure 2, vibration 50, flow 0, tool position 15. Energy 5.0. High temp and vibration again. Flow is 0, which might mean the material isnt moving.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Event 9: very high temp, high vibration, no flow. This might be Welding. Welding can have high temp and vibration, but maybe the material isnt moving.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Events 10-12: lower temp, some flow. Tool position is 20. Maybe assembling parts here? The flow is 1, which is low but not zero.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Events 10-12: temp 25, flow 1, tool position 20. This could indicate parts being assembled, with the tool moving to different positions to place components.

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: What about events 7-8? They have tool position 15, which is between cutting and welding. Maybe thats a transition. Alternatively, maybe events 7-8 are part of the cutting process.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: The labels would be: Cutting: events 4-6, Welding: event 9, Assembling: events 10-12. The events 7-8 might be a transition between cutting and welding.
